result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clarron Antwon Hall

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Clarron Antwon Hall appeared by video. Attorney Michael Chernin appeared by video as a friend of the Court. Attorney M. Samir Siddique appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.
State informed the Court that this case may be deferred prosecution agreement eligible.
Defendant to schedule a TAD evaluation.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 30.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 093805,
Payable Number: 1036354,
Receipt Number: 22RP039621,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Clarron Antwon Hall appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defendant does not have counsel and was referred to the State Public Defender's Office. 
Case adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 8/20/22. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Clarron Antwon Hall in court.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/18/2022@1p
